messages.speech: Web servers usually give developers the ability to add small pieces of dynamic code inside static HTML pages, without having to deal with fullfledged serverside or clientside languages.This feature is incarnated by the ServerSide Includes (SSI). The attacker will try to inject code into the application that will be interpreted by SSI mechanisms. A successful exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to inject code into HTML pages or even perform remote code execution.
